net.sourceforge.taglets.driver.impl
Class AbstractDriver

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.taglets.driver.impl.AbstractDriver
All Implemented Interfaces:
Driver, DriverCallback
Direct Known Subclasses:
TagletDriver, TagletDriver
public abstract class AbstractDriver
extends Object
implements Driver, DriverCallback

Abstract driver implementation for JavaDoc compliant taglets.

The driver converts SimpleTaglets to JavaDoc compliant taglets. The actual taglet implementation required is JavaDoc specific, therefore concrete driver implementations will return different taglet types.

Version:
1.9 (2008/03/30 12:43:24)
Maintainer:
Bruno Essmann <essmann@sourceforge.net>
See Also:
Driver
Since:
1.3.1

Constructor Detail

AbstractDriver

protected AbstractDriver()
Creates a new abstract taglet trader.

Note:

Concrete implementations should register(ConverterFactory) their factories in the constructor.

Since:
1.3.1
Method Detail

register

protected void register(ConverterFactory factory)
Registers a new converter factory at this trader.

Note:

Factories are queried in the order they are added and the first factory able to fulfill a request will be used, i.e. register specific factories first and generic factories last.

Parameters:
factory - the factory to register.
Since:
1.3.1

getFactoryFor

public ConverterFactory getFactoryFor(SimpleTaglet taglet)
Returns a converter factory that can handle taglets of the specified type.

Parameters:
taglet - the taglet for which to retrieve a suitable factory.
Returns:
the factory or null if there is none.
Since:
1.3.1

setDestinationDirectory

public void setDestinationDirectory(String destinationDirectory)
Sets the documentation output directory.

The driver will be able to determine the destination directory as soon as output generation by JavaDoc starts.

Note:

It is expected that the driver will set the destination directory as early as possible.

Specified by:
setDestinationDirectory in interface DriverCallback
Parameters:
destinationDirectory - the output directory for the documentation.
Since:
1.9.0

isPreferredDriver

public abstract boolean isPreferredDriver()
Description copied from interface: Driver
Checks if this driver is the preferred driver for the running version of JavaDoc.

Specified by:
isPreferredDriver in interface Driver
Returns:
true if the driver thinks it can handle the current JavaDoc version and thinks it is the best driver for the given version, false otherwise.
Since:
1.3.1

configure

public void configure(Logger logger,
                      Configuration configuration)
Description copied from interface: Driver
Indicates that this driver has been chosen as the JavaDoc driver for the current run and should initialize itself.

Specified by:
configure in interface Driver
Implementation Notes:
The default implementation emits an info message that this driver is being used and stores the logger and configuration for later use.}
Parameters:
logger - the logger to use for message output during configuration.
configuration - the configuration to use.
Since:
1.3.1

Specified by:

Returns:
